ranked_diseases.explanation: All three reference cases with identical phenotype constellation (intellectual disability, short stature, microcephaly) were diagnosed with this condition. Patient shares 3/5 features seen in reference cases.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Microcephalic osteodysplastic primordial dwarfism, type II
ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic triad of severe microcephaly, profound short stature, and intellectual disability. MOPDII is characterized by extreme growth restriction and microcephaly.
Features microcephaly, severe proportionate short stature, and intellectual disability as cardinal features. Missing typical bird-like facial features but core triad is present.
Presents with intellectual disability, growth retardation, and microcephaly. Missing characteristic facial features and limb abnormalities but core features overlap.
Features microcephaly and short stature as primary characteristics. Intellectual disability is variable. Missing typical ear abnormalities and absent patellae.
Can present with intellectual disability and acquired microcephaly. Patient is male (gender 1) making classic Rett less likely, but severe variants possible. Missing regression phase.
Features intellectual disability and can have microcephaly. Short stature less common. Missing characteristic happy demeanor, ataxia, and seizures seen in reference cases.
